alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 12:53PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...An area of convective snow showers will move across Elko County... At 1226 PM this afternoon doppler radar is tracking an area of scattered snow showers across northern Nevada moving from southwest to northeast. Showers are beginning to move into Elko County. SPC outlooks paired with environmental analysis indicate a region of enhanced instability across Elko County. Snow showers are expected to strengthen and produce brief periods of squall like conditions. Heavy bands of snow and gusty winds with gusts around 40 mph will be in the area. Visibility will be reduced to 1/2 mile or less under any such activity along with localized light accumulations ranging from a skiff to 2 inches. Activity is expected to exit the forecast area around 0800 PM. Travel will become difficult under any such conditions and extreme caution should be exercised if impacted by a band of heavy snow. Slow down and turn on headlights. Pull off the highway if needed and into a safe area and wait until conditons clear. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
